metadata.title: CVE-2016-2337 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
Type confusion exists in _cancel_eval Ruby's TclTkIp class method. Attackerpassing different type of object than String as "retval" argument can causearbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2337` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~16.04
ruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~16.04
ruby2.3-tcltk - 2.3.1-2~16.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.3 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-2~16.04').
